newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela bolivar slips as dollar demand rises.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela bolivar slips as dollar demand rises.

text.p: The Venezuelan bolivar closed slightly weaker at 473.00/474.00 per dollar Monday compared to 472.50/473.75 per dollar Friday as demand for foreign currency was only partially met by the Central Bank, traders said.
"We attended to plenty of corporate demand (for foreign currency)," one trader said.
Though the Central Bank met most of this demand, some clients were still short dollars, meaning that pressure on the bolivar was likely to continue Tuesday, traders added.
